alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 2:37PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oklahoma, northern Cleveland, northwestern Pottawatomie and west central McClain Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 237 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Goldsby, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Newcastle, Choctaw, Harrah, McLoud, Jones, Nicoma Park, Goldsby, Stella, Tinker Air Force Base, Dale, Stanley Draper Lake, Newalla and northwestern Lake Thunderbird. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 104 and 118. Interstate 40 between mile markers 158 and 178. Interstate 240 between mile markers 8 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
